item.title: Steve Martin is serious about comedy
item.description:
I once heard an interview with comedian Steve Martin, and was surprised at how serious he sounds when discussing his profession. I expected comedy, but when he talks about what he does, vs doing it, he's all business. It made an impression.

Heh this was a test to see if everything is still working. https://t.co/YOQfxiYixj
item.source:markdown:
I once heard an interview with comedian Steve Martin, and was surprised at how serious he sounds when discussing his profession. I expected comedy, but when he talks about what he does, vs doing it, he's all business. It made an impression.
Heh this was a test to see if everything is still working. https://t.co/YOQfxiYixj

item.description: Please don't blame Twitter for Google's lack of interest in RSS as they dominated it. https://t.co/cozYUrIow3
item.source:markdown: Please don't blame Twitter for Google's lack of interest in RSS as they dominated it. https://t.co/cozYUrIow3

item.description:
@conoro @TwitterDev I really don't agree with the "stupidly" part. I was there then, and saw what the problem was. It wasn't that was unwilling, it's just that Google had its fat ass parked on RSS and they decided all posts had to have titles, and as we all know --

TWEETS DON'T HAVE TITLES.

@conoro @TwitterDev It's about time people understood the history here.

Blaming Twitter for Google's both dominating RSS and refusing to implement the spec -- that's misplaced hate.

Google could easily have worked with Twitter, and they should have.

@conoro @TwitterDev Instead it was a mess, until Twitter decided that paying for the mess wasn't a great idea. Still to this day you blame them for it, but it wasn't their doing. They tried.

I want in the future RSS to be smart, not dominated by a huge company that doesn't give a shit.
Honestly if the Knicks had to pick a rival I expect it would be Dolan.
item.source:markdown: Honestly if the Knicks had to pick a rival I expect it would be Dolan.

item.description: @LegionHoops this is insulting. the knicks and nets are not "rivals."
item.source:markdown: @LegionHoops this is insulting. the knicks and nets are not "rivals."

If you have questions or comments please post them here.

item.title: Where's the feed?
item.description:
With all the talk today about feeds for Twitter with Markdown that work in any feed reader, it's time for me to show you something for real that isn't hype. ðŸ˜„

This is the feed of my tweets.

https://t.co/0FnLWgnRKT

You can and should subscribe to it in any feed reader.

Let's find out how well this idea works in practice.

As they say...

Still diggin! ;-)

PS: More stuff tomorrow.
item.source:markdown:
With all the talk today about feeds for Twitter with Markdown that work in any feed reader, it's time for me to show you something for real that isn't hype. :smile:
This is the feed of my tweets.
https://t.co/0FnLWgnRKT
You can and should subscribe to it in any feed reader.
Let's find out how well this idea works in practice.
As they say...
Still diggin! ;-)
PS: More stuff tomorrow.

item.description: RSS and Markdown were made for Twitter or is it the other way around.
item.source:markdown: RSS and Markdown were made for Twitter or is it the other way around.
